String.string: Lancers can hold their ground by setting their shield, creating a safe zone behind them, and keeping BAMs at bay.
You don't have to do everything by yourself. Group up to tackle challenges, BAMs, and dungeons.
Treat your party with respect. Successful players get more invitations. Jerks, however, do menial labor.
No matter how strong you are, you're always stronger with a good party by your side.
Use the Looking for Group tool (Y key) to quickly assemble parties to take on dungeons and BAMs.
A properly-structured party can take on almost anything. A skilled tank, a talented healer, and several damage dealers is all you need.
Mentor younger players and show them the ropes. Kindness pays off in the long run.
Set your party's expectations up front and hold players accountable. Your parties will run smoother and accomplish more without tensions and bad attitudes.
Use the Instance Matching tool to quickly assess which instances you're geared up enough to tackle.
Don't flirt with people during a BAM fight. They're focused on their job. You should be, too.
Enter /join [Party Member's Name] to apply to an existing group. You should ask politely first, of course.
Enter /? Party to bring up a list of commands available to parties.
Your enemies are ready for the next fight. Are you? Stock up on consumables before leaving town.
Verify the level of other players' items by right-clicking them and inspecting their gear. If they're undergeared, they might be liabilities in a party.
All party members should carry resurrection scrolls and bandages.
Party leaders can choose the loot distribution methods. Good party leaders make it clear up front which one they're using.
Do all your snacking before the party gets started. Nobody tanks or heals well with greasy fingers.
It's okay to give party members breaks for the necessities of life. They'll come back focused and ready to fight.
Know your role in a party and choose the abilities that maximize your impact while harmonizing with the abilities of others.
If you die in an instance, don't accept the default resurrection. You'll end up in the nearest town—and annoy the rest of your party.
Before you start a fight, agree on a kill order and mark your targets. It makes life so much easier.
Knowledge is power. Quest text often provides answers to the questions that seem to flood the chat channel.
The amani sport of "huumka" has one simple rule: stay inside the circle!
The guwangi in Rift's Edge grow big when they are angry.
If travel by airship is supposed to be safe, why do they keep crashing?
Highwatch, the barakas' home in Northern Arun, is filled with lore lost to the rest of the world for an age.
The pegasus isn't so much a living creature as it is a transportation device. It only flies between set routes.
The Garden of the Sun is the home of the Consos clan—a group of barakas who worship Balder, the Sun God. They protect Balder's last remaining temple, to honor his sacrifices.
The archdevas may look like familiar enemies, but they're full of surprises!
A new continent, with new challenges. Who knows what adventure awaits you?

Gunners utilize a sophisticated magical weapon, called an arcannon, to produce a variety of ballistic effects. They say that the feeling of channeling magic like that is almost overwhelmingly exciting!
Take control! Get to your alliance exarch's office, and win honor and power.
Each alliance elects its own exarchs on each server. Speak to your alliance administrator to apply.
The position of exarch is determined by popular vote.
The Free Traders' Collective believes you're entitled to keep every coin you earn—because money is power.
Stand with the Iron Order against the forces that seek to destroy the federation—from within as well as from without.
Mutual respect is worth its weight in gold. Let the Enlightened Union enrich you.
Discovering Timeless Woods ——Borromi (Ascension Valley)
——Razorstrike (Tempest Reach)
My very first pegasus flight ——Serenneth (Mount Tyrannas)
Defeating Nightmare Shandra Manaya ——Luna.Sol (Tempest Reach)
Hanging out with friends ——Poolish (Mount Tyrannas)
Dracoloths occasionally descend upon the world of TERA. It takes a strong group to fend them off.
The most dangerous of the argons—their queen, Shandra Manaya—is determined to unmake the Dream.
The fae of Sylvanoth have tapped into the goddess Isren's power to fight back the argon invasion.
To learn the skills and intricacies of your class, try soloing BAMs. To kill them faster, attack from behind!
Adding enhancement crystals to your weapon ensures the boss feels those crits!
Using extra feedstock while enchanting greatly increases your chances of success.
After level 20, glyphs enhance your skills and make you more formidable against monsters and other players. Talk to a glyphmaster to learn them!
Purchases from the TERA Store—and rewards from events and holidays—arrive via Item Claim. Log in and check often so you don't miss any!
When fighting bosses and BAMs, the red circle shows who has combat aggro. The purple circle indicates the BAM is casting something on you.
Since the discovery of noctenium was announced, the market for it has grown exponentially.
Only a handful of technicians in the whole world can safely handle noctenium.
The frantic race to acquire noctenium has jeopardized the stability of the Valkyon Federation.
Guilds with similar goals unite in an alliance for protection and power.
Mysterium researchers used noctenium to create invisibility potions.

With guilds still fighting to gain entry, the Lightkeepers raised the temple into the sky and ended a destructive faction war. Lightkeeper Alptinus promised to share its secrets, but only if the guilds behaved.
The relics contained inside Nakatam Tower are both mysterious and powerful. Is it any wonder the Lightkeepers guard them so fiercely?
The Cursus Honorum exists to keep guild conflicts from boiling over. Those who follow it are among the most honorable of guilds.
Lightkeeper Alptinus built Nakatam Tower on the ruins of an ancient temple. Who knows what secrets it conceals?
The Cursus Honorum is a code of honor for guilds. Those who follow it are sure to succeed.
Have you considered joining an alliance?
